attributes.description:
This table provides a detailed, searchable log of all audit events. It is the primary tool for verifying that specific, required audit event content is being captured.

**Why this visualization works:**
It offers a granular, unfiltered view of the raw data, which is essential for compliance verification. You can inspect individual log entries to confirm they contain the necessary details (e.g., user, source IP, action taken).

**How an analyst can use it:**
Use the search bar at the top of the table to filter for specific event types, users, hosts, or keywords relevant to your organization's audit requirements. For example, search for 'event.action:login' to verify login events are being recorded. Sort by different columns to analyze patterns. This table is your ground truth for CCI-000130 compliance.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"event.module: (auditd or auditbeat or sysmon or system or security or powershell or osquery or \"windows\" or \"linux\" or \"aws\" or \"gcp\" or \"azure\") OR event.dataset: (*.log or *.audit or *.security or *.system or *.application or \"cloudtrail\" or \"guardduty\") OR event.category: (authentication or configuration or database or driver or file or host or iam or intrusion_detection or malware or network or package or process or registry or session or threat or web) OR event.type: (access or change or connection or creation or deletion or end or error or group or info or installation or modification or process_started or protocol or start or user)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [AU-3 CCI-000130] Audit Event Log

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table identifies the specific `event.action` types that are exhibiting anomalously low counts, as required by CCI-000130. It provides the necessary detail to investigate a potential logging failure identified in the trend chart.

**How to Use:** When the trend chart shows an anomaly, consult this table. It will show the `event.action` and `host.name` with a high anomaly score. This tells you, for example, that 'user-login' events from 'server-01' have dropped unexpectedly. This allows you to focus your investigation on the authentication logging mechanisms for that specific server.
attributes.title: [AU-3, CCI-000130] ML - Event Actions with Low Volume
attributes.visState: {"title":"[AU-3, CCI-000130] ML - Event Actions with Low Volume","type":"table","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"max","params":{"field":"anomaly_score","customLabel":"Max Anomaly Score"},"schema":"metric"},{"id":"2","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"event.action","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":10,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"},{"id":"3","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"host.name","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":10,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"}],"params":{"perPage":10,"showPartialRows":false,"showMetricsAtAllLevels":false,"sort":{"columnIndex":null,"direction":null},"showTotal":false,"totalFunc":"sum","showToolbar":true,"percentageCol":"","autoFitRowToContent":false}}

attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-000130, which requires ensuring that specific, organization-defined audit events are being generated and logged. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, use the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. For example, filter by 'host.name: <your_component_name>' to focus on a single server or workstation. Then, review the 'Audit Event Log' table to confirm that the events you expect to see are present. You can use the search bar within the table to look for specific 'event.action' types (e.g., 'login', 'file_delete', 'process_started') or other keywords. The 'Event Actions Breakdown' and 'Events by Module' visualizations will help you quickly see if expected event types or log sources are missing entirely.
attributes.title: [AU-3 CCI-000130] Audit Events
attributes.visState: {"title":"[AU-3 CCI-000130] Audit Events","type":"markdown","aggs":[],"params":{"markdown":"# [CCI-000130] Audit Events\n\n### Ensure required audit event content is logged.","fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false}}

attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status of CCI-000130 compliance based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. High scores may indicate an abnormally low count of specific event actions, suggesting a failure to log required events.
attributes.title: [CCI-000130] Audit Events ML

attributes.description:
This chart shows the total count of different event actions over time. It helps you quickly verify if expected actions are being logged and to spot any unusual spikes or dips in activity.

**Why this visualization works:**
It provides a high-level overview of system activity. If your policy requires logging all file modifications, but you see no 'file_modify' events, this chart makes that gap immediately obvious.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Review the chart to ensure that all event actions defined in your organization's audit plan are present. Look for any actions that have a count of zero, as this may indicate a logging failure. Use the time selector to investigate specific periods of interest. Click on a specific action in the legend to filter the dashboard for only that event type.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"event.module: (auditd or auditbeat or sysmon or system or security or powershell or osquery or \"windows\" or \"linux\" or \"aws\" or \"gcp\" or \"azure\") OR event.dataset: (*.log or *.audit or *.security or *.system or *.application or \"cloudtrail\" or \"guardduty\") OR event.category: (authentication or configuration or database or driver or file or host or iam or intrusion_detection or malware or network or package or process or registry or session or threat or web) OR event.type: (access or change or connection or creation or deletion or end or error or group or info or installation or modification or process_started or protocol or start or user)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [AU-3 CCI-000130] Event Actions Breakdown

attributes.description:
This chart displays the distribution of audit events by the reporting module (e.g., auditbeat, winlogbeat, osquery). It helps confirm that all your deployed logging agents are active and sending data.

**Why this visualization works:**
It provides a simple, clear view of your log sources. If a critical system is supposed to be reporting via a specific beat and that module is missing from this chart, you have a clear indicator of a compliance gap.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Check the chart to ensure all expected 'event.module' values are present. If a module is missing, it could mean the agent is down or misconfigured on one or more systems. Click on a slice of the pie to filter the dashboard and see only the events from that specific module.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"event.module: (auditd or auditbeat or sysmon or system or security or powershell or osquery or \"windows\" or \"linux\" or \"aws\" or \"gcp\" or \"azure\") OR event.dataset: (*.log or *.audit or *.security or *.system or *.application or \"cloudtrail\" or \"guardduty\") OR event.category: (authentication or configuration or database or driver or file or host or iam or intrusion_detection or malware or network or package or process or registry or session or threat or web) OR event.type: (access or change or connection or creation or deletion or end or error or group or info or installation or modification or process_started or protocol or start or user)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [AU-3 CCI-000130] Events by Module
